title: How to Perform a Vitamin E Oil Face Treatment

steps.headline: Cover your face with a warm towel for 3 minutes.
steps.description: Place a towel or into a bowl of warm or hot water. Remove the towel from the water and wring it out completely. When the fabric is warm and not hot to touch, place the towel over your face for several minutes to expand your facial pores. The oil can soak more efficiently into your skin when your pores are opened.

steps.headline: Coat your fingertips in vitamin E oil.
steps.description: Squeeze a pea-sized amount of vitamin E product onto your fingers. If you want, you can rub the product into your fingers before applying it so the product can coat your skin more evenly. Vitamin E oil comes in a variety of different bottles. Depending on the brand or product, you might have to pump the oil onto your hands instead of squeezing or pouring it.

steps.headline: Rub the oil into your skin with your fingertips.
steps.description: Take the oil and apply it to your face in long, circular movements. Let your fingers sweep over your face, covering your cheekbones, forehead, and chin area. Continue rubbing the production in until your entire face is evenly covered. Use caution when adding any oil to your eyelid area. Since this skin is more sensitive, it might have a negative reaction to the oil.

steps.headline: Leave the oil on overnight or wash it off after 15 minutes.
steps.description: Allowing the oil to soak into your skin during the night is preferable, but this isn't feasible for all skin types. Some people may experience rashes, irritation, and other side effects if they leave the oil on their face for that long. If you're worried about side effects, wash off the vitamin E oil after about 15 minutes. Once you know how well you tolerate the oil, you can work up to longer applications. Keep in mind that vitamin E oil can be sticky and get on your pillows and sheets. Makeup and other skincare products don't layer well over vitamin E oil, which is why night applications are preferred.

steps.headline: Massage your face with vitamin E oil every 2 days before bed.
steps.description: Maintain a routine skincare regimen, coating your skin with vitamin E oil before bed each night. Aim to do this treatment around 3-4 times a week. Although vitamin E is great for nourishing your skin, you don’t want to leave your complexion oily. If you experience side effects, like irritation, rash, or breakouts, discontinue the use of vitamin E oil or apply it less frequently.

steps.headline: Avoid applying pure vitamin E oil to naturally oily or prone to acne.
steps.description: Pure vitamin E oil is quite heavy and is known to clog pores and cause breakouts. If your skin is oil or acne-prone, you may want to avoid applying pure vitamin E oil to your face. Instead, look for serums and products suited for oily skin that contain vitamin E as an ingredient.

steps.headline: Soothe dry skin with a vitamin E oil treatment.
steps.description: Vitamin E oil can be an excellent natural moisturizer for treating dry skin. Try applying the oil at night once per week to see if it works for you. If the oil feels to heavy on its own, try mixing a few drops of it into your favorite moisturizer and applying the moisturizer as you normally would.

steps.headline: Use vitamin E oil to prevent skin inflammation and UV light damage.
steps.description: If your skin tends to swell or burn easily in the sunlight, try applying vitamin E oil to your face in addition to sunscreen before you go out in the sun. If your skin is chronically inflamed, try using vitamin C and D supplements in addition to applying vitamin E topically. Vitamin E oil can also help lessen skin thickness, edema, and erythema.

steps.headline: Target dark spots with vitamin E oil.
steps.description: Applying vitamin E oil directly to darker patches of skin may help to make them less obvious. Apply the oil to the affected area only instead of doing a full-face application. Try to do this on a daily basis for 4-6 weeks to see if your dark spots respond to this treatment.

steps.headline: Prevent wrinkles and signs of aging with frequent vitamin E oil application.
steps.description: Rub on some vitamin E oil 3-4 times per week before bed can help to keep your skin looking youthful and elastic. While vitamin E oil doesn’t remove wrinkles completely, it can help to keep your skin’s collagen intact and soften the look of fine lines. As an antioxidant, vitamin E is a huge help to the skin since it helps protect it from free radicals that cause premature aging.

methods.name: Mixing Vitamin E with Other Products

steps.headline: Mix aloe vera gel with vitamin E oil if you have aging skin.
steps.description: Spoon 3 to 4 teaspoons (15 to 20 mL) of aloe vera into a small bowl. Next, puncture a capsule of vitamin E oil with a safety pin or other sharp object so the oil can also be squeezed into the bowl with the aloe vera. Use a spoon to stir the ingredients together, creating a light green mixture. Coat your fingertips in this mixture and apply it to your face in small, circular motions. This treatment is especially good if you’re trying to make your skin look dewy and youthful. You can find aloe vera gel at most grocery or health supply stores. Double, triple, or multiply this recipe however much you want to create a larger batch.

steps.headline: Combine vitamin E oil and petroleum jelly if your skin is dry.
steps.description: Scoop 0.5 teaspoons (2.5 mL) of petroleum jelly into a small bowl. Don’t worry if you have to scrape the product onto the edges of the bowl—this serum will end up being very thick. Puncture and squeeze 1 capsule of vitamin E oil into the bowl of petroleum jelly, and stir the 2 substances together vigorously. Once both ingredients are thoroughly mixed, use the tips of your fingers to apply the serum around your face in round, circular movements.Warning: Don’t use this serum if you have especially oily skin. The petroleum jelly could cause your skin to break out.

steps.headline: Mix vitamin E oil with other natural ingredients to create face mask.
steps.description: Add 1 teaspoon (4.9 mL) of plain yogurt and 1 teaspoon (4.9 mL) of honey into a small bowl. Next, pour in 1 teaspoon (4.9 mL) of lemon juice, as well as 4-5 drops of vitamin E oil. Mix these ingredients together until they form a paste. Apply this all over your face with a makeup brush, and rinse it off after 10 minutes with cool water. Try not to leave this mask on for too long, as it might make your skin feel irritated.

Face towel/cloth (or other method of drying face)
Brush or tissue (optional, to apply to face)
